EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network at positions (0.0, 0.0), (5.0, 0.0), (2.5, 0.5) & (2.5, -0.5)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace for Iron Smelting at (0.0, 0.0) paired with a Burner Inserter at (1.5, 0.5) and a Dedicated Output Chest at (0.5, 2.5)
• Stone Furnace for Copper Smelting at (5.0, 0.0) with a Burner Inserter at (3.5, 0.5)
• Common Input Chest – Wooden Chest at (2.5, 0.5) stocking copper-plate
• New Feeder Inserter – Feeder Inserter at (2.5, -0.5) with pickup at (2.5, -1.5) and drop at (2.5, 0.5)
• Transport Belt Connection linking the mining output to the feeder inserter

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup at (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of:
• Burner Mining Drill at (-15.0, -50.0) with output drop at (-14.5, -48.5)
• Drill Inserter at (-13.5, -47.5) transferring ore
• Sink Chest – Wooden Chest at (-11.5, -46.5) serving as temporary ore storage
• Sink Inserter – Burner Inserter at (-10.5, -46.5) with pickup at (-9.5, -46.5) and drop at (-11.5, -46.5)
• Transport Belt Connection linking the mining drill drop to the sink inserter pickup

### Automation Research Lab at (5.5, 5.5)
Consists of:
• Lab at (5.5, 5.5) (status: NO_POWER; research on Automation still in progress)
• Electricity Network comprising:
 – Small Electric Pole at (5.5, 3.5)
 – Small Electric Pole at (8.5, 5.5)
 – Small Electric Pole at (3.5, 5.5)
 – Additional Small Electric Pole at (14.5, 10.5)
 – Extra Small Electric Pole at (7.5, 5.5) placed to improve local power
• Steam Engine (Generator) at (11.5, 7.5)
• Electricity Group Connection linking the Lab to the Steam Engine via the network of poles

### Water Supply System for Power Generation
Consists of:
• Offshore Pump at (-9.5, 24.5) extracting water
• Boiler at (4.0, 18.5) meant to convert water to steam
• Steam Engine (Generator) at (11.5, 7.5)
• Pipeline Network with multiple reconfiguration attempts:
 – Originally a PipeGroup connection (fluid_system=129) at approx (14.5, 7.5) that was later ineffective
 – Junction Pipe placed near the Offshore Pump at approximately (-7.5, 24.5)
 – Junction Pipe placed near the Boiler at (5.5, 19.5)
 – Intermediate junction pipes at (-4.5, 23.5) and (0.5, 21.5) along a defined waypoint route
 – A manually placed connector Pipe at (5.5, 18.5) (using Direction.RIGHT as fallback)
• Despite these attempts, a clear fluid connection between the Offshore Pump and Boiler remains unestablished due to repeated placement and connection issues

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Pipe Connection and Network Configuration Issues:
 – When connecting the Offshore Pump to the Boiler (whether directly or via junction/intermediate pipes), ensure both source and target connection points are free from obstructions and that the connection geometry meets the target’s fluid intake requirements
 – Reevaluate the alignment, spacing, and intermediary junction placements if encountering placement blockage errors

• Connector Pipe Placement Challenges:
 – Before placing a connector adjacent to an entity (for example, next to the Boiler), confirm that the target tile is not already occupied
 – Adjust spacing or change the reference direction to avoid overlapping existing pipe entities

• Pipe Crafting and Resource Availability:
 – Verify that all necessary sub-ingredients (such as iron plates) are available by employing the correct production method before attempting to craft composite items like Pipes

• Lab Power and Research Dependencies:
 – Reinforce lab connectivity by ensuring that additional power poles are placed in clear, buildable spots to resolve persistent lab NO_POWER status
 – Do not attempt to craft advanced machinery (e.g. Assembling Machine 1) until the ongoing Automation research requirements are fully met

NAMESPACE
─────────
• shift_entity_local(entity: Entity, offset: Tuple[float, float]) -> Entity  
 – Shifts the given entity’s position by the specified offset  
  • Success: Entity is repositioned correctly  
  • Failure: Prototype mismatches may occur if identifier strings are not standardized

• nearest_buildable(position: Position) -> BoundingBox  
 – Determines the nearest buildable area surrounding a given position for entity placement  
  • Success: Returns a valid bounding box for placement  
  • Failure: Misuse of property access can trigger errors

• place_entity_next_to(prototype: Prototype, reference_position: Position, direction: Direction, spacing: int) -> Optional[Entity]  
 – Attempts to place an entity of the given prototype adjacent to a reference position based on the specified direction and spacing  
  • Success: Returns the placed entity  
  • Failure: Returns an error if the target position is occupied or invalid

Important Variables:
• furnace_input_chest_pos (Position) – Holds the position of the furnace input chest  
• current_player_inventory (Inventory) – Tracks the current state of the player’s inventory  
• mining_drill_drop (Position) – Stores the mining drill’s output drop position  
• target_chest_position (Position) – Represents the position of the attempted transport belt connection target
